title: What is CSS?
answer_1: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheet.
answer_2: CSS is a markup language used for structuring and displaying content on the internet
answer_3: CSS Like HTML To Write A Simpl Code
right_answer: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheet.

title: What is the origin of CSS?
answer_1: It is a popular styling language which is used with HTML to design
answer_2: It can also be used with any XML documents including plain XML, SVG
answer_3: SGML.is the origin of CSS. It is a language that defines markup languages.
right_answer: SGML.is the origin of CSS. It is a language that defines markup languages.

title: How can you integrate CSS on a web page?
answer_1: Inline method - It is used to insert style sheets in HTML document
answer_2: Embedded/Internal method - It is used to add a unique style to a single document
answer_3: Linked/Imported/External method - It is used when you want to make changes on multiple pages.
right_answer: ALL answers Are Right

title: What is Specificity?
answer_1: If there are two or more CSS rules that point to the same element, the selector with the highest specificity value will 'win', and its style declaration will be applied to that HTML element.
answer_2: in Css doesn't have Specific
answer_3: There are only two categories which define the specificity level of a selector:
right_answer: If there are two or more CSS rules that point to the same element, the selector with the highest specificity value will 'win', and its style declaration will be applied to that HTML element.

title: what about !important Rule
answer_1: The !important rule in CSS is used to add more importance to a property/value than normal.
answer_2: The !important rule in CSS is used to add more opecity to a property/value than normal.
answer_3: In fact, if you use the !important rule, it will non-override ALL previous styling rules for that specific property on that element!
right_answer: The !important rule in CSS is used to add more importance to a property/value than normal.
